description: NTS Map:92B6.  Built in the 1890s as part of a system of coastal defences, Fort Rodd Hill and nearby Fisgard Lighthouse occupies 45 acres of Garry Oak forests with walking trails throughout the historic fort. Signs, audio and video programs and interpretive staff make this a wonderful way to spend a couple of hours exploring. Special events in the summer are the highlight of any visit.
directions:
From downtown Victoria: 

Fort Rodd Hill and Fisgard Lighthouse National Historic Sites are 14 km (8.4 miles) by road west of downtown Victoria, B.C.
  
Head north on Douglas Street (Victoria's main street) until it turns into Highway 1
  
Follow Highway 1 for 5 km (3 miles), then take the Colwood exit (exit #10)
  
Follow Highway 1A for 2 km (1.2 miles), then turn left at the third traffic light onto Ocean Boulevard
  
Follow the signs to the sites.
title: Fort Rodd Hill National Historic Site
